FuncDef: The display ipv6 routing-table vpn-instance protocol command displays the routing table of an IPv6 address family-enabled VPN instance. The display ipv6 routing-table vpn-instance protocol command displays the routing table of an IPv6 address family-enabled VPN instance. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: display ipv6 routing-table vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> protocol { bgp | direct | isis | ospfv3 | ripng | static } [ time-range <min-age> <max-age> ] [ inactive | verbose ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Displays routes of a specified protocol.
-

Displays routes that are generated within a specified period.
-

Specifies the start generation time.
The value is a string of characters, in the format of XXdXXhXXmXXs.

Specifies the end generation time.
The value is a string of characters, in the format of XXdXXhXXmXXs.

Displays the summary of inactive routes only.
-

Displays detailed information about active and inactive routes.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI] display ipv6 routing-table vpn-instance vrf1 protocol direct
